de.iabg.mode
Class ModeCorrelationMatrix

java.lang.Object
  de.iabg.math.AbstractMatrix
      de.iabg.math.RectangularMatrix
          de.iabg.mode.ModeCorrelationMatrix
All Implemented Interfaces:
Matrix
public class ModeCorrelationMatrix
extends RectangularMatrix

This Matrix is designed to store the values of a correlation between all modes of two objects of ModeMatrix. The naming conventions used in this implementation are First or First Modes for the rows and Last or Last Modes for the columns. This class also provides the method getPreferredConnection(double), which returns a ModeConnectionMatrix. The returned matrix is a mapping between the First Nodes and Last Nodes based on the maximum correlation. This mapping is determined by searching this matrix for the maximum correlation between any two modes and swapping the corresponding row and column with the first row and column. The first row and column are omitted from the next search, which searches the remaining nodes for the maximum correlation. The corresponding row and column are swapped with the second row and column. This procedure is done iteratively until the given minimum correlation tolerance is reached. Thus, a mapping based on the maximum correlation is formed along the diagonal, which is ultimately returned to the user. This procedure is robust in that it will find the best mapping for any ordering of the stored modes. The algorithm, however, requires significant memory storage and may not properly execute for large systems. The 2D matrix that this correlation represents can also be rendered in Java3D by calling getScene2D(double, javax.vecmath.Color3f) or getScene3D(double, javax.vecmath.Color3f). The color of a cell is green if it is less than the lower tolerance, yellow if it between the lower and upper tolerances, and red if it is greater than the upper tolerance. These tolerance values can be set to customize the rendering.

Version:
September 11, 2008
Author:
Adam C. Dick, BSE

getConnection

public ModeConnectionMatrix getConnection()
Returns the diagonal values of this matrix as a new ModeConnectionMatrix. This method simply copies the names and frequencies of the First Modes and Last Modes and the correlation along the diagonal into the ModeConnectionMatrix. Therefore, this method does not guarantee anything about the quality of the mapping.

Returns:
the connection of the modes along the diagonal

getPreferredConnection

public ModeConnectionMatrix getPreferredConnection(double tolerance)
Returns a mapping between the First Modes and Last Modes based on the maximum correlation. This method makes a copy of this class and calls sortDiagonalDescending() with the given tolerance. A ModeConnectionMatrix is then created from the sorted correlation and reduced to the given tolerance.

Parameters:
tolerance - the minimum correlation tolerance
Returns:
the connection of the modes based on a maximum correlation

sortColumns

public void sortColumns(KeyList columnKeys)
Sorts and resizes the number of columns in this matrix according to the order of the given column names. This method overrides the previous implementation to include the mode frequencies. The number of given column names may be smaller than the number of column names in this matrix, thus reducing the number of columns. The corresponding cells of the given columns are also sorted in the same way. The data of any column which is omitted will be lost.

Overrides:
sortColumns in class RectangularMatrix
Parameters:
columnKeys - the new order of the column names

sortDiagonalDescending

protected void sortDiagonalDescending()
This method iteratively searches this matrix for the maximum correlation mapping and places them along the diagonal. The algorithm begins by searching the entire matrix for the maximum value. The corresponding row and column are swapped into the first row and first column. The next search omits the row and column and searches the matrix for the next largest value. The corresponding row and column are swapped into the second row and second column. The next search proceeds by omitting the first two rows and first two columns. Thus, the maximum mapping between the First Modes and Last Modes is built along the diagonal.

sortRows

public void sortRows(KeyList rowKeys)
Sorts and resizes the number of rows in this matrix according to the order of the given row names. This method overrides the previous implementation to include the mode frequencies. The number of given row names may be smaller than the number of row names in this matrix, thus reducing the number of rows. The number of given row names may also contain duplicate values, thus increasing the number of rows. The corresponding cells of the given rows are also sorted in the same way. The data of any row which is omitted will be lost.

Overrides:
sortRows in class RectangularMatrix
Parameters:
rowKeys - the new order of the row names

swapColumns

public void swapColumns(int firstIndex,
                        int lastIndex)
Swaps the data and names of the columns at the given indices. This method overrides the previous implementation to include the mode frequencies.
